definition: An attention mode where an agent maintains focus on a task, stimulus, or goal over an extended period of time.

positive_examples: He stayed focused on the monitoring console for hours.
The system tracked the same process continuously without dropping events.
She kept her attention on the conversation despite the long meeting.
negative_examples: His focus kept jumping from one notification to another.
The agent briefly checked the logs and then moved on.
She glanced at the gauges but did not keep watching them.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not momentary focus; specifically the ability to keep attention on the same target over time.
